flaskeleton.filemanager package¶

Submodules¶

flaskeleton.filemanager.files module¶

flaskeleton.filemanager.files.ERROR_INVALID_NAME = 123¶

Windows-specific error code indicating an invalid pathname.

https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/ms681382%28v=vs.85%29.aspx

Official listing of all such codes.

class flaskeleton.filemanager.files.File(mainfest: flaskeleton.filemanager.files.FileManifest)¶

Bases: object

Handles the creation and population of files and directories.

create_and_write_files() → bool¶

Loops through the file manifest and creates the files

Returns

True if no errors creating files, False if any are encountered

Return type

bool

static write_file(file: str, rendered_template: str) → None¶
class flaskeleton.filemanager.files.FileContent(file_contents: str)¶

Bases: object

class flaskeleton.filemanager.files.FileManifest¶

Bases: object

Manages a list of strings representing paths to files that we want to create.

add_to_manifest(path: flaskeleton.filemanager.files.FilePath, content: flaskeleton.filemanager.files.FileContent) → bool¶

Adds non duplicate paths to the file manifest list

Parameters

  • path (str) – full path to file including filename.

  • content (FileContent) – Contents – if any, to be written to the file.

Returns

True when the value is added to the manifest, False when not.

Return type

bool

remove_from_manifest(path: flaskeleton.filemanager.files.FilePath = None) → bool¶

Removes the provided path from the file manifest list, provided it exists

Parameters

path (FilePath) – full path to file including filename.

Returns

True when the file is removed from the file manifest list. False when not.

Return type

bool

class flaskeleton.filemanager.files.FilePath(file_path: str)¶

Bases: object

flaskeleton.filemanager.files.is_pathname_valid(pathname: str) → bool¶

Checks the validity of the provided path.

Parameters

pathname (str) – full path to file including filename

Returns

True if the passed pathname is a valid pathname for the current OS; False otherwise.

Return type

bool

Example

>>> print(str(is_pathname_valid('foo.bar')))
True
>>> print(str(is_pathname_valid('')))
False
>>> print(str(is_pathname_valid('a' * 256)))
False
